body:
Comment 1: 
I'm not sure that text belongs there.
What you're describing is a feature of calls, not of method sets.
From the Calls section:

A method call x.m() is valid if the method set of (the type of) x
contains m and the argument list can be assigned to the parameter list
of m. If x is addressable and &x's method set contains m, x.m() is
shorthand for (&x).m()
_Owner changed to @griesemer._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
